availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Mullin (Franklin County, Kentucky, trader and farmer.)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, trader and farmer. Native of Ireland. Trader in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Farmer in Franklin County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 31A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 870.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 220.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 485B.
"John Mullin (1815-1865)," Find A Grave, Memorial 43189450, accessed April 26, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43189450.
